definition: see 三個和尚沒水喝|三个和尚没水喝[san1 ge4 he2 shang5 mei2 shui3 he1]

definition: surname San
three/3
variant of 個|个[ge4]
individual/this/that/size/classifier for people or objects in general
to combine a powdery substance (flour, plaster etc) with water/Taiwan pr. [huo4]
to compose a poem in reply (to sb's poem) using the same rhyme sequence/to join in the singing/to chime in with others
old variant of 和[he2]/harmonious
surname He/Japanese (food, clothes etc)
old variant of 和[he2]
to mix (ingredients) together/to blend/classifier for rinses of clothes/classifier for boilings of medicinal herbs
to complete a set in mahjong or playing cards
and/together with/with/sum/union/peace/harmony/Taiwan pr. [han4] when it means "and" or "with"
still/yet/to value/to esteem

(negative prefix for verbs)/have not/not
drowned/to end/to die/to inundate
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
variant of 吃[chi1]
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])

lit. three monks have no water to drink (idiom)/fig. everybody's business is nobody's business/(If there is one monk, he will fetch water for himself. If there are two, they will fetch water together. But if there are three or more, none will take it upon himself to fetch water.)
pinyin: san1 ge4 he2 shang5 mei2 shui3 he1

definition: lit. to eat from the common pot (idiom)/fig. to be rewarded the same, regardless of performance
tragedy of the commons (economics)
mutually shirking responsibilities (idiom); each blaming the other/passing the buck to and fro/each trying to unload responsibilities onto the other
to beg for food (of monks)
virtue has its reward, evil its retribution
pinyin: shan4 you3 shan4 bao4 , e4 you3 e4 bao4

definition: three men talking makes a tiger (idiom); repeated rumor becomes a fact
when everybody gathers fuel, the flames are higher (idiom)/the more people, the more strength
pinyin: zhong4 ren2 shi2 chai2 huo3 yan4 gao1

definition: common saying/proverb
half-cooked rice/(fig.) half-finished job that is difficult to complete because it was not done properly in the first instance/Taiwan pr. [jia4 sheng5 fan4]
(Buddhism) retribution/karma

Kong Rong giving up pears, classic moral story about Kong Rong 孔融[Kong3 Rong2] picking up smaller pears while leaving the bigger ones to his older brothers, still used nowadays to educate the young on courtesy and modesty
an ant hole may cause the collapse of a great dike (idiom)/huge damage may result from a moment's negligence
pinyin: qian1 li3 zhi1 di1 , kui4 yu2 yi3 xue2

definition: to pass the buck/to shirk responsibility

a fire in the city gates is also a calamity for the fish in the moat (idiom); the bystander will also suffer/fig. you can't escape responsibility for your actions/ask not for whom the bell tolls - it tolls for thee
pinyin: cheng2 men2 shi1 huo3 , yang1 ji2 chi2 yu2

definition: lit. a child who cries gets to feed at the breast (idiom)/fig. the squeaky wheel gets the grease
